Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL ?; PAINTED
Name: Vase decorated by means of the potter's wheel
Description: This vase in clay is characterised by a decoration made with the potter's wheel. The exterior part comprises three rows of pointed balls in whitish clay and placed symetrically.The decoration made with the potter's wheel and the form of the vase is typically roman. The piece, which dates from the 1st or the 2nd century of our time, comes from the excavations of F. Griffith at Faras in 1910.
